revised_title: Leaf-arrangement Variations in the Crowberry (Empetrum nigrum)
tldr: The authors study the leaf arrangement in the crowberry plant (Empetrum nigrum) and find that it exhibits a high degree of variation in leaf arrangement on different parts of the same twig. The transition between different leaf arrangements is brought about by a spiral dislocation between adjacent secondary ranks, which is a phenomenon not seen in other plants.
